ideallight: Gerbera plants thrive best in bright, indirect sunlight for most of the day. They prefer a well-lit environment where the light is diffused rather than harsh, helping maintain vibrant blooms and preventing leaf burn. A spot near an east-facing or lightly filtered south window is ideal.
watering: Keep soil evenly moist, but avoid overwatering.
tips: Ideal light: Gerbera plants thrive best in bright, indirect sunlight for most of the day. They prefer a well-lit environment where the light is diffused rather than harsh, helping maintain vibrant blooms and preventing leaf burn. A spot near an east-facing or lightly filtered south window is ideal.
Tolerated light: Partial shade to full sun.
Watering: Keep soil evenly moist, but avoid overwatering.
Soil: Use regular indoor potting soil with good drainage.

watering: Low watering; drought tolerant.
tips: Prefers dry, rocky soils.
Does not tolerate waterlogged ground.
Deadhead flower spikes to maintain shape.

watering: Keep soil evenly moist.
tips: Avoid direct harsh sunlight.
Use well-draining soil to avoid root rot.
Trim damaged leaves to maintain appearance.
